001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006
007import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.State;
008
009/**
010 * Baseline parameters for a person in the simulation. These are parameters that
011 * are fixed for the person and do not change over the course of the simulation.
012 * They are set once during configuration but their effects may be modified by
013 * the person's behaviour through the {@link PersonState}.
014 *
015 * <p>
016 * These represent the core features of this individual that are unchanged and
017 * to which the person will return during the simulation.
018 *
019 * @author Rob Challen
020 */
021@Value.Immutable
022public interface PersonBaseline extends Serializable {
023
024        /**
025         * How likely is this person to use an app on any given day.
026         *
027         * @return the baseline probability of app use for this person, which is
028         *         modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of others in the
029         *         network
030         */
031        Double getAppUseProbability();
032
033        /**
034         * How likely is this person to comply with instructions compared to another
035         *
036         * @return the baseline compliance probability for this person, which is
037         *         modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of others in the
038         *         network
039         */
040        Double getComplianceBaseline();
041
042//      Double getLowRiskMobilityIncreaseTrigger();
043//      Double getHighRiskMobilityDecreaseTrigger();
044//      Double getHighRiskMobilityModifier();
045
046        /**
047         * The default behaviour state for this person. This is the state that they
048         * will revert to when not influenced by their own behaviour or the
049         * behaviours of others in the network. It is also the state that they will
050         * start in at the beginning of a simulation.
051         *
052         * @return the default behaviour state for this person, which is modified by
053         *         their behaviour and the behaviours of others in the network
054         */
055        State.BehaviourState getDefaultBehaviourState();
056
057        /**
058         * A probability of contact of another person in the social network.
059         *
060         * @return the baseline probability of contact for this person, which is
061         *         modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of others in the
062         *         network
063         */
064        Double getMobilityBaseline();
065
066        /**
067         * The minimum mobility modifier that a person will experience. This is an
068         * odds ratio that is applied to their baseline probability
069         *
070         * @return the minimum mobility modifier for this person, which is applied to
071         *         their baseline probability and modified by their behaviour and the
072         *         behaviours of others in the network
073         */
074        Double getSelfIsolationDepth();
075
076        /**
077         * How likely is a this person to have no symptoms when infected
078         *
079         * @return the baseline probability of false negative symptoms for this
080         *         person, which is modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of
081         *         others in the network
082         */
083        Double getSymptomSensitivity();
084
085        /**
086         * How likely is a this person to have false positive symptoms when not
087         * infected
088         *
089         * @return the baseline probability of false positive symptoms for this
090         *         person, which is modified by their behaviour and the behaviours of
091         *         others in the network
092         */
093        Double getSymptomSpecificity();
094
095}
